channel.title: Sprite loading

item.title: Sprite loading
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

That is terrible! You monster! You need an init method and an ImageObserver so that you can load all images completely, store them in fields, and THEN AND ONLY THEN try to draw it.

I’m not here to teach anything special or correct/wrong. I’m just saying what is needed to be done lol. You just made it sound more complicated.

Read full topic

item.title: Sprite loading
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

May not be what your looking for, but here is a small snippet:

ImageIcon image = new ImageIcon(path);
Image picture =  image.getImage();

Also, you do need to draw the image, not just get it.

g.drawImage(Image, X, Y, null);

Read full topic

item.title: Sprite loading
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

I’m trying to load a sprite, but it isn’t loading?

public void paint (Graphics g) { g.drawString("The game", 100, 60); setBackground(Color.black); setForeground(Color.white); getImage(null, "images/cool.png"); }

I’ve got a folder images and cool.png in it. Images/cool.png.

Read full topic
